server
Class GuestBookServer

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      server.GuestBookServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class GuestBookServer
extends java.lang.Thread

A GuestBookServer is a threaded application. When run it listens to the specified port for incoming service requests. When it receives a request it creates a new ClientHandler thread to handle the request, and continues listening at the port for further connection attempts. The GuestBookServer connects to an Oracle server via a RealDatabaseHandler. The server will fail to start if the server is not found, as it cannot service requests without the database.

GuestBookServer

public GuestBookServer(javax.swing.JLabel update)
                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Initializes the server, setting the port, number of handlers, and listen timeout to their defaults. The driver for the database is also loaded.

Parameters:
update - optional JLabel (can be null) for status updates
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC-Oracle driver is not found

                    int time)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
